notes.text:
An update for kernel-rt is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The kernel-rt packages provide the Real Time Linux Kernel, which enables fine-tuning for systems with extremely high determinism requirements.

Security Fix(es):

* kernel: bpf: Incorrect verifier pruning leads to unsafe code paths being incorrectly marked as safe (CVE-2023-2163)

* kernel: tun: bugs for oversize packet when napi frags enabled in tun_napi_alloc_frags (CVE-2023-3812)

* kernel: use after free in nvmet_tcp_free_crypto in NVMe (CVE-2023-5178)

* kernel: use-after-free due to race condition occurring in dvb_register_device() (CVE-2022-45884)

* kernel: use-after-free due to race condition occurring in dvb_net.c (CVE-2022-45886)

* kernel: use-after-free due to race condition occurring in dvb_ca_en50221.c (CVE-2022-45919)

* kernel: use-after-free in smb2_is_status_io_timeout() (CVE-2023-1192)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A race condition flaw leading to a use-after-free issue was found in the Linux kernel media subsystem in the DVB core device driver. It could occur in the dvb_register_device() function due to the file_operations structure (fops) being dynamically allocated and later kfreed. A local user could use this flaw to crash the system or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: use-after-free due to race condition occurring in dvb_register_device()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker must either have credentials for a vulnerable system and physical access to its ports, or they must have the elevated privileges necessary to control USB via sysfs. For that reason, Red Hat assesses the impact of this vulnerability as Moderate.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

To mitigate this issue, it is possible to prevent the affected code from being loaded by blacklisting the `dvb-core` kernel module. For instructions on how to blacklist a kernel module, please see https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: use-after-free due to race condition occurring in dvb_register_device()

notes.text: A race condition flaw leading to a use-after-free issue was found in the Linux kernel media subsystem in the dvb_net component of the DVB core device driver. It could occur between the time the device is disconnected (.disconnect function)  and the time the device node is opened (dvb_device_open function). A local user could use this flaw to crash the system or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: use-after-free due to race condition occurring in dvb_net.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Because this vulnerability requires an attacker to either have physical access to a system with DVB hardware or requires a remote authenticated user to have knowledge about DVB hardware attached to the system and when it is disconnected and reconnected, Red Hat assesses the impact of this vulnerability as Moderate.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

To mitigate this issue, it is possible to prevent the affected code from being loaded by blacklisting the `dvb-core` kernel module. For instructions on how to blacklist a kernel module, please see https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: use-after-free due to race condition occurring in dvb_net.c

notes.text: A race condition flaw leading to a use-after-free issue was found in the Linux kernel media subsystem in the DVB CA EN50221 interface of the DVB core device driver. It could occur in the dvb_ca_en50221_release() function if there is a disconnect after an open, because of the lack of a wait_event. A local user could use this flaw to crash the system or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: use-after-free due to race condition occurring in dvb_ca_en50221.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Because this vulnerability requires an attacker to either have physical access to a system with DVB hardware or requires a remote authenticated user to have knowledge about DVB hardware attached to the system and when it is disconnected and reconnected, Red Hat assesses the impact of this vulnerability as Moderate.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

To mitigate this issue, it is possible to prevent the affected code from being loaded by blacklisting the `dvb-core` kernel module. For instructions on how to blacklist a kernel module, please see https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278.

names: Pumpkin (@u1f383), working with DEVCORE Internship Program

notes.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in smb2_is_status_io_timeout() in CIFS in the Linux Kernel. After CIFS transfers response data to a system call, there are still local variable points to the memory region, and if the system call frees it faster than CIFS uses it, CIFS will access a free memory region, leading to a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: use-after-free in smb2_is_status_io_timeout()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Because analysis indicates that this issue will only cause momentary interruptions to connections, Red Hat rates the impact of this flaw as Low.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options don't meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

notes.text: An incorrect verifier pruning flaw was found in BPF in the Linux Kernel that may lead to unsafe code paths incorrectly marked as safe, resulting in arbitrary read/writes in kernel memory, lateral privilege escalation, and container escape.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: bpf: Incorrect verifier pruning leads to unsafe code paths being incorrectly marked as safe
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.3 not affected, because the required patch applied before this CVE creation. For the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 before version 9.3 required fixes applied too.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

The default Red Hat Enterprise Linux kernel prevents unprivileged users from being able to use eBPF by the kernel.unprivileged_bpf_disabled sysctl. This would require a privileged user with CAP_SYS_ADMIN or root to be able to abuse this flaw reducing its attack space.

For Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 to confirm the current state, inspect the sysctl with the command:

# cat /proc/sys/kernel/unprivileged_bpf_disabled

The setting of 1 would mean that unprivileged users can not use eBPF, mitigating the flaw.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: bpf: Incorrect verifier pruning leads to unsafe code paths being incorrectly marked as safe

notes.text: An out-of-bounds memory access flaw was found in the Linux kernelâs TUN/TAP device driver functionality in how a user generates a malicious (too big) networking packet when napi frags is enabled. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: tun: bugs for oversize packet when napi frags enabled in tun_napi_alloc_frags
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.
To mitigate this issue, prevent the tun module from being loaded. Please see https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278 for how to blacklist a kernel module to prevent it from loading automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: tun: bugs for oversize packet when napi frags enabled in tun_napi_alloc_frags

notes.text: A use-after-free vulnerability was found in drivers/nvme/target/tcp.c` in `nvmet_tcp_free_crypto` due to a logical bug in the NVMe/TCP subsystem in the Linux kernel. This issue may allow a malicious user to cause a use-after-free and double-free problem, which may permit remote code execution or lead to local privilege escalation.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: use after free in nvmet_tcp_free_crypto in NVMe
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This vulnerability is actual only for systems where NVME over TCP being used.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options don't meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: use after free in nvmet_tcp_free_crypto in NVMe
